{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3658073,"name":"Doruk Yılmaz","username":"drk_yilmaz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/7ba0ec/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T18:18:05.940Z","cooked":"

Hello, I connected everything without any problems, there is no problem with pdh roborio etc. but I am getting such a warning in limelight hardware manager, what could be the reason? Because of this, it appears as connecting on the website and it did not work even after waiting. Can you help me?

I just realized that the IP addresses that appear in Limelight and the driver station are different. How can I solve this?

image1918×1028 84 KB

image1919×1078 98.4 KB

Oddly enough, we ran into a similar issue at comp this year. I still have no clue what cause this but there was something running on our laptop that was bound to the same IP address as the Limelight. We were able to run ping <ip> in command prompt without the Limelight even connecting and something was responding. We were using a USB-Ethernet adapter, and the solution at the time was to disable the Wifi adapter on the computer, change the Limelight’s IP address, and re-enable the adapter.
